prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Juste output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text: One night two young men from Egulac went down to the river to hunt seals and while they were there it became foggy and calm. Then they heard war-cries, and they thought: 'Maybe this is a war-party'. They escaped to the shore, and hid behind a log. Now canoes came up, and they heard the noise of paddles, and saw one canoe coming up to them. There were five men in the canoe, and they said: 'What do you think? We wish to take you along. We are going up the river to make war on the people.' One of the young men said,'I have no arrows.' 'Arrows are in the canoe,' they said. 'I will not go along. I might be killed. My relatives do not know where I have gone. But you,' he said, turning to the other, 'may go with them.' So one of the young men went, but the other returned home. And the warriors went on up the river to a town on the other side of Kalama. The people came down to the water and they began to fight, and many were killed. But presently the young man heard one of the warriors say, 'Quick, let us go home: that Indian has been hit.' Now he thought: 'Oh, they are ghosts.' He did not feel sick, but they said he had been shot. So the canoes went back to Egulac and the young man went ashore to his house and made a fire. And he told everybody and said: 'Behold I accompanied the ghosts, and we went to fight. Many of our fellows were killed, and many of those who attacked us were killed. They said I was hit, and I did not feel sick.' He told it all, and then he became quiet. When the sun rose he fell down. Something black came out of his mouth. His face became contorted. The people jumped up and cried.He was dead.
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. . Juste output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
stories: Two young men from Egulac ventured down to the river one evening for seal hunting. Suddenly, fog rolled in and the water grew still. Suddenly, war cries echoed through the air, causing the men to worry that they had stumbled upon a war party. They quickly hid behind a log on the shore. As they waited, canoes approached, and they could hear the sound of paddles. One canoe came close, carrying five men. They asked the young men if they wanted to join them on their journey to wage war on a town upriver. One man declined, saying he didn't have any arrows and didn't want to risk being killed, as his relatives didn't know where he was. He told the other man that he could go if he wanted. So, one man went with the warriors while the other returned home. The warriors traveled upriver and attacked a town, where a battle ensued and many people were killed. During the fight, one of the warriors was hit and the others decided to return home. The young man who had joined them went back to his house and built a fire. He recounted his experience to his family and friends, saying that he had gone to fight with the ghosts and that many had died on both sides. He then revealed that he had been injured, and soon after, he died. Black substance came out of his mouth and his face became distorted. The people were alarmed and cried out.

"Two guys from Egulac decided to go hunting for seals by the river one evening. Suddenly, fog rolled in and the water became calm. Then, they heard war cries, making them fear it was a war party they had stumbled upon. They hid behind a log near the shore. Soon, boats appeared, and they heard the sound of paddles. One canoe came near with five men. They asked the young men if they wanted to join them in their expedition to battle a town upriver. One declined, stating he lacked arrows and didn't wish to be killed without his family knowing. He advised the other to go if he wished. So, one man joined the warriors, while the other returned home. The warriors proceeded upriver and attacked a town, where a conflict took place, resulting in numerous casualties. During the fight, one warrior was wounded, prompting the group to return home. The man who joined them went back to his house and started a fire. He shared his experience with his family and friends, saying that he had fought alongside ghosts and that many had perished on both sides. He then admitted to being hurt, shortly before dying. Black substance came out of his mouth, and his face became deformed. The people were terrified and screamed."

Two individuals residing in Egulac chose to venture to the river one evening for seal hunting. When fog rolled in and the water became still, they heard war cries, causing them to worry that they had stumbled upon a war party. They concealed themselves behind a log near the shore. Eventually, boats arrived, and they heard the sound of paddles. A canoe carrying five men drew close and inquired if they wanted to join their expedition to clash with a town upriver. One refused, revealing that he lacked arrows and didn't want to die without his family being informed. He encouraged the other to participate if he wished. Consequently, one man joined the warriors, while the other went back home. The warriors proceeded upriver and raided a town, leading to significant casualties during the battle. A single warrior was injured, compelling the group to return home. The man who accompanied them went back to his residence and lit a fire. He recounted his adventure to his family and friends, confessing that he had battled alongside ghosts, resulting in many losses on both sides. He then confessed to being hurt, followed by black substance oozing from his mouth and his face becoming disfigured. The people were horrified and screamed.

"Two people living in Egulac decided to go hunting for seals by the river one evening. After fog descended and the water became calm, they heard war cries, making them fear they had encountered a group of warriors. They hid behind a log near the shore. Later, boats arrived, and they heard the sound of paddles. A canoe with five men approached and invited them to join a raid on a town upriver. One man declined, as he didn't have arrows and didn't want to die without saying goodbye to his family. He let the other man join if he wished. So, one man left with the warriors, and the other returned home. The warriors reached a town, attacked, and caused many casualties. However, they had to retreat after one warrior was injured. The man who had joined them returned to his home and told his family and friends about his experience, confessing that he had fought alongside ghosts, resulting in many casualties. He then admitted to being hurt and began to vomit a black substance and his face became disfigured. This made everyone scream in horror."

Two people from Egulac decided to go to the river's mouth to hunt a seal, feeling uncomfortable because of the river's calmness and the thick fog that indicated a possible threat. They hid behind a log and heard what seemed like war cries and stronger paddle sounds. A canoe with five people showed up, asking for help to attack a village upstream. One of them declined, expressing his unwillingness to fight without a weapon and his dedication to protecting his family. Another one agreed to go with them. They attacked the village, injuring many people before retreating when one of them got hurt. The one who declined later shared a story about fighting alongside unfamiliar beings, resulting in destruction and experiencing a transformation after encountering an unknown substance.
